{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms of sudden onset left-sided abdominal pain, tenderness of the left adnexa, and a large amount of fluid in the rectouterine pouch on ultrasound are suggestive of a gynecological issue. Ectopic pregnancy is less likely because her last menstrual period ended 2 days ago and she is not showing signs of pregnancy. Pelvic inflammatory disease usually presents with bilateral lower abdominal pain, fever, and abnormal vaginal discharge, which is not the case here. Ovarian torsion usually presents with sudden onset severe pain, nausea, and vomiting, which are not mentioned in the case. A ruptured ovarian cyst can cause sudden onset pain, and the fluid in the rectouterine pouch could be due to the rupture.", "answer_choice": "D. Ruptured ovarian cyst"}
